alert.note: Alert for North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 2:20PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Arapahoe, central Denver and southwestern Adams Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 220 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Aurora, or 7 miles east of Denver, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eastern Denver, northwestern Aurora, southwestern Denver International Airport and Buckley SFB. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County
